Job Title: Associate Finance Business Analyst

Location: Alpharetta, GA

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Analyst, Information Technology, Research

Description:
Requisition ID: 5866

Job Title: Associate Finance Business Analyst

Job Country: United States (US)

Here at Avanos Medical, we passionately believe in three things:

 Making a difference in our products, services and offers, never ceasing to fight for groundbreaking solutions in everything we do;  Making a difference in how we work and collaborate, constantly nurturing our nimble culture of innovation;  Having an impact on the healthcare challenges we all face, and the lives of people and communities around the world. 

At Avanos you will find an environment that strives to be independent and different, one that supports and inspires you to excel and to help change what medical devices can deliver, now and in the future.

The Avanos COVID-19 Vaccine Policy: This Policy applies to U.S. customer-facing / field-based employees & Avanos leadership: All U.S. customer-facing / field-based employees hires must be fully vaccinated against COVID-19. Proof of being fully vaccinated does not need to be disclosed until a job offer has been made but must be submitted within 48 hours after the acceptance of the job offer. If you have a qualifying medical condition or sincerely held religious belief or practice that precludes you from receiving a COVID-19 vaccine, you may apply for an exemption or deferral after you accept the job offer and before your scheduled start date. The reasonable accommodation provided to the employee, if any, will depend on the employee’s job and the applicable facts, but it may include weekly COVID-19 testing and masking requirements. New hires who do not submit, before their scheduled start date, proof of being fully vaccinated or a request for a reasonable accommodation will have their job offer revoked.

Avanos is a medical device company focused on delivering clinically superior breakthrough solutions that will help patients get back to the things that matter. We are committed to creating the next generation of innovative healthcare solutions which will address our most important healthcare needs, such as reducing the use of opioids while helping patients move from surgery to recovery. Headquartered in Alpharetta, Georgia, we develop, manufacture and market recognized brands in more than 90 countries. Avanos Medical is traded on the New York Stock Exchange under the ticker symbol AVNS. For more information, visit www.avanos.com .

We are currently seeking an Associate Business Analyst to support our Global FP&A organization, reporting to the Director of Finance. This is a unique hybrid role that will support both the commercial and corporate FP&A teams.

The Commercial FP&A aspect of the role will consist of serving as a financial partner to functions within the commercial organization including commercial operations, reimbursement, and strategic initiatives teams. The individual will be responsible for building budgets, reports, and analysis to help drive accountability of spend and activities through insightful analysis, forward thinking recommendations, and counseling in the development and implementation of the commercial teams’ strategies and objectives.

The Corporate FP&A aspect of the role will involve assisting the finance organization with the management reporting system (BPC), providing support and guidance during reporting, budgeting, and forecasting processes. The individual will be the main point of contact between the finance users and our IT partners to document any system issues and lead remediation efforts. The individual will also be the point of contact for ad-hoc requests from other corporate functions including tax, treasury, and accounting.

The Associate Business Analyst will be a key member of the cross-functional team responsible for business and operations analysis, financial planning and reporting, and other financial, strategic, and tactical services.

Principal Duties And Responsibilities

 Lead the quarterly forecast and annual budget process for the Commercial support functions  Effectively communicate financial performance across the organization  Support month-end close activities to ensure timely and accurate results  Enhance operating expense visibility and bring accountability to spending activities with budget owners  Work with the Director to evaluate internal and external strategic opportunities  Assist with our management reporting system (train new users, setup forecast and budget scenarios, document and work with our IT partners for remediation and improvement)  Assist and lead special ad hoc projects as needed 

Minimum Qualifications

 Minimum 3 years of experience in a finance or analysis role  Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Business or other related field  Ability to deal with multiple tasks, work under strict deadlines, and prioritize effectively to complete requests in a timely manner  Strong oral, written, and presentation skills to deliver effective, confident, and results-oriented communications and presentations, including to senior executives  Broad understanding of finance, economics, business management, business/strategic planning  Advanced Excel skills and ability to build financial models, reports, tools  Self-starter/ ability to work independently 

Preferred

 MBA  SAP, BPC, and Power BI experience  Prior knowledge, exposure, or general interest in medical device industry 

The statements above are intended to describe the general nature and level of work performed by employees assigned to this classification. Statements are not intended to be construed as an exhaustive list of all duties, responsibilities and skills required for this position.

Avanos Medical is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or any other characteristic protected by law. If you are a current employee of Avanos, please apply here .

Join us at Avanos

Join us and you can make a difference in our products, solutions and our culture. Most of all, you can make a difference in the lives, people, and communities around the world.

Make your career count

Our commitment to improving the health and wellbeing of others begins with our employees – through a comprehensive and competitive range of benefits. We provide more than just a salary – our Total Rewards package encompasses everything you receive as an employee; your pay, health care benefits, retirement plans and work/life benefits.

Avanos offers a generous 401(k) employer match of 100% of each pretax dollar you contribute on the first 4% and 50% of the next 2% of pay contributed with immediate vesting.
